page.title: 19 GOG MAGOG GOLF COURSE 2
page.content: {Administration } Income derived from 1000 club member subscriptions. 20-30 new members p.a. 100 juniors play on NEW COURSE. No plans to increase number of members. 90% of county players derived from club. { History { }Founded 1901 by fellows of Cambridge University. New club house built 1919. Lord Rutherford and Peter Alliss have played at Club. { Course The OLD COURSE 18 holes. The course is hill and heathland with fine blades. NEW COURSE is 9 holes for less demanding play. {Professional { }Teaches 4-5 lessons each week on new course. Organises tournaments between April and September for visiting societies. Assists with running shop.
